thread.title: Faulkner Roundup: Hendrix, UCA and CBC soccer
thread.title_full: Faulkner Roundup: Hendrix, UCA and CBC soccer

author: Staff
title: Faulkner Roundup: Hendrix, UCA and CBC soccer
text:
Faulkner Roundup: Hendrix, UCA and CBC soccer Posted: October 1, 2015 - 7:46pm LOG CABIN DEMOCRAT 
MEMPHIS, Tenn. — Sydnie Schindler’s goal in double overtime gave Rhodes a 2-1 soccer victory over Hendrix on Wednesday night in the Warriors’ women’s soccer Southern Athletic Association opener. 
The host Lynx (6-3-1, 1-0) scored the first goal of the game in the 15th minute when Angie Hurlow found the net. The Warriors (6-3-1, 0-1) tied the game in the 21st minute when senior forward Sydney King scored on an assist from senior Samantha Lallas. UCA MEN’S SOCCER 
Memphis, Tenn. – The University of Memphis got a hat trick from Raul Gonzalez in a 3-1 men’s soccer victory Wednesday over the University of Central Arkansas. 
The Tigers are 1-5-2 while the Bears fell to 1-8. 
UCA’s goal came from Pepe San Roman in the 35th minute. 
Central Arkansas opens Missouri Valley Conference play on Saturday night, traveling to Edwardsville, Illinois to take on SIU-Edwardsville. CBC SOCCER 
PARKVILLE, Mo. — Park University defeated Central Baptist College twice in soccer Wednesday, winning the women’s game, 3-1 and the men’s 3-0. 
Tara Hendricks scored the Mustangs’ lone goal at 58.10 in the second half. 
The Mustangs had 3 shots on goal, Park had 15 with 11 saved by CBC’s goalkeeper Kalynn Simpson. 
The Mustang men were held scoreless and played a tight first half with the Pirates allowing one early score. CBC then held Park in check until late in the second half were Rodolfo Lopez and Cyril Gadu each added a score to make the final 3-0.
